subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: ... It s not a merger of all three, just the elimination of Ox in favor of either Awe or Ah, depending on dialect.  The four underlying lexical sets are the
messageBody:
Moira O'Brien scripsit:
> As a speaker of RP, I can't agree to the merger
> of Awl Ah and On. My pronunciation makes full use of all three as
> distinct sounds.

It's not a merger of all three, just the elimination of Ox in favor of
either Awe or Ah, depending on dialect. The four underlying lexical
sets are the worst mess in the English dialects.

--
John Cowan cowan@... http://ccil.org/~cowan
The whole of Gaul is quartered into three halves.
-- Julius Caesar

Moira O'Brien scripsit:
> As a speaker of RP, I can't agree to the merger
> of Awl Ah and On.  My pronunciation makes full use of all three as
> distinct sounds.

It's not a merger of all three, just the elimination of Ox in favor of
either Awe or Ah, depending on dialect.  The four underlying lexical
sets are the worst mess in the English dialects.
